p: The in vivo antidiarrheal index (ADI) was measured by considering three parameters as shown in Table 4. These are delays in defecation (Dfreq), gut meal travel distance (Gmeq), and purging frequency in the number of wet stools (Pfreq). The 80% methanolic extract showed an antidiarrheal index of 50.28, 69.10, and 80.19 at doses of 100, 200, and 400 mg/kg, respectively, while standard drug produced a maximum index of 83.86. Moreover, 80% of methanol extract showed a dose-dependent increment in ADI value.
